clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of I-Shape Incısıon Technique on Inter-Implant Papilla: A Prospective Randomized Clinical Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of I-Shape Incısıon Technique on Inter-Implant Papilla: A Prospective Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Regenerating a predictable inter-implant papilla is the most complex and challenging aspect of implant dentistry. The aim of the study was to compare the efficacy of I shaped incision technique and conventional midcrestal incision technique for interimplant papilla reconstruction in a 6 month clinical trial.

detailed_description.textblock: A total of 40 implants were placed in 12 patients. Groups were determined at second stage surgery, I shape technique used in test group and mid-crestal technique used in control group. The clinical parameters, including modified plaque index, modified sulcus bleeding index, probing depth, keratinized tissue level were recorded baseline, 3 and 6 month. The vertical distance between the crests top-contact point was evaluated with digital periapical radiographs at baseline 3 and 6 month. Also the clinical photographs were taken baseline, 3 and 6 month. Two T shaped full-round hexagonal straight filaments, each 5 mm, were used in the taking of standardized images. With these images the ratio of the papilla area in proportion to the embrasure area and the papilla classification was measured. Non-parametric test were used for statistically analysis.

primary_outcome.description: Baseline will be 1 week after cementation of the crowns.
Papilla fill index will be recorded 3rd month after baseline
Papilla fill index will be recorded 6th month after baseline

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline crestal bone level up to 3 months
primary_outcome.description: Crestal bone loss was measured on radiographs between baseline-3rd month.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline crestal bone level up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Crestal bone loss was measured on radiographs between baseline-6th month.
Inter-implant vertical distance between the crests top-contact point was also evaluated with digital periapical radiographs.

secondary_outcome.description: The level of probing depth at baseline. Probing depth was measured with a plastic periodontal probe.
The level of probing depth at 3 month. Probing depth was measured with a plastic periodontal probe.
The level of probing depth at 6 month. Probing depth was measured with a plastic periodontal probe.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Modified sulcus bleeding index was recorded at baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Modified sulcus bleeding index was recorded at four sites of implants after 10 sec. of probing.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Modified sulcus bleeding index was recorded at 3 month
secondary_outcome.description: Modified sulcus bleeding index was recorded at four sites of implants after 10 sec. of probing.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Modified sulcus bleeding index was recorded at 6 month
secondary_outcome.description: Modified sulcus bleeding index was recorded at four sites of implants after 10 sec. of probing.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Modified plaque index was recorded at baseline
secondary_outcome.description: The dichotomous presence of supra gingival plaque was recorded at four sites of implants

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Modified plaque index was recorded at 3 month
secondary_outcome.description: The dichotomous presence of supra gingival plaque was recorded at four sites of implants

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Modified plaque index was recorded at 6 month
secondary_outcome.description: The dichotomous presence of supra gingival plaque was recorded at four sites of implants

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Keratinized tissue level was recorded at baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Keratinized tissue level measured with a plastic periodontal probe

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Keratinized tissue level was recorded at 3 month
secondary_outcome.description: Keratinized tissue level measured with a plastic periodontal probe

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Keratinized tissue level was recorded at 6 month
secondary_outcome.description: Keratinized tissue level measured with a plastic periodontal probe

arm_group.description: Second stage surgery was made I shape incision technique .
In the control group second stage surgery was made using the conventional method, midcrestal technique.

intervention.description: The clinical photographs were taken baseline, 3 and 6 month. Two T shaped full-round hexagonal straight filaments, each 5 mm, were used in the taking of standardized images.
Crestal bone loss was measured on digital radiographs at baseline, 3 and 6 month with a Java program me (Image-J 3.0 NIH, Bethesda, USA)
The change of probing depth between baseline, 3 and 6month. Probing depth was measured with a plastic periodontal probe (mm)
Modified bleeding index was measured baseline, 3 and 6 month. Presence of bleeding on probing were performed at four sites of implants.
Modified plaque index was measured baseline, 3 and 6 month. Presence of plaque index was performed at four sites of implants.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- No sistemic condition, and age > 18 years,
- healthy soft tissue (bleeding on probing (BOP) ≤ 20%, Plaque Index ≤ 15%,
- in a need of at least two collateral implants in the maxilla from second premolar to second premolar
- sufficient keratinized tissue
- no bone augmentation procedures before implant placement
- use of tobacco 10N ≥ cigarettes daily
- sufficient distance between opposite occluding dentition at the proposed implant sites
Exclusion Criteria:
- history of aggressive periodontitis,
- systemic diseases such as diabetes
- pregnant or lactating women
- radiation therapy in the head and neck area wihtin the previous 12 months,
- heavy smokers
- bruxism.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Özge PEHLİVANOĞLU, PhD,DDS Ege University, School of Dentistry
